page.title: 10PERCY COLUMN
page.content: The Percy Tenantry Column lies at the side of the road into Alnwick from the south.There is a plaque on one side of the column which was erected,dedicated and inscribed by thankful tenantry of the second Duke of Northumberland in 1816 who,in times of great depression reduced the rents.The column is made of sandstone and there are four stone lions around the base.There is another lion on top of the column.A feature of this lion is its straight tail (a symbol of the Percy lion). The grounds of the column are well_kept and many towns_folk use the grounds for sunbathing and having picnics.
